modules.description: Provides pretty-printers for error and write error types, and implements read, write, and writev operations on flow objects. Works with buffer types represented as Cstruct.t and asynchronous I/O operations wrapped in Lwt.t. Used to handle data transmission, error reporting, and connection termination in network or file-based flow operations.

Provides pretty-printers for error types and functions for reading from and writing to network flows. Operates on buffer types representing raw data and flow objects managing network connections. Reads data into buffers until EOF or connection closure, writes buffers or lists of buffers to flows, and closes connections gracefully.

Provides pretty-printers for error types and functions to read from, write to, and manage the lifecycle of a network flow. Operates on buffer types representing raw data and flow objects encapsulating network connections. Enables handling of network communication by reading data, writing buffers, and gracefully closing or shutting down connection directions.

This module handles read, write, and close operations for network and in-memory flows, utilizing Cstruct.t buffers, strings, and managing asynchronous data refilling and flow control. It addresses error scenarios through specialized types like `error` and `write_error`, enabling reliable data transfer in scenarios requiring precise buffer management and network communication.

Provides functions to manipulate and inspect network flow data structures, including packet parsing, header extraction, and state tracking. Works with custom types representing network packets, flow states, and protocol-specific data. Used to implement protocol handlers and traffic analysis in Mirage-based network applications.

Provides functions to read from and write to network flows, including handling errors and closing connections. Operates on buffer types derived from Cstruct.t and custom error types for I/O operations. Used to manage data transmission in asynchronous network applications, such as sending and receiving packets with proper error reporting and connection termination.
